events.name: Introduction to Developing Cross-Platform Mobile Apps Using Flutter
events.description:
Learn how to build beautiful native apps in record time using Flutter, Google's mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on IOS and Android in record time, plus it's FREE and Open Source!

In the process, we will also learn about Dart, a free an open-source, scalable programming language, created by Google, on top of which Flutter was developed.

This talk will be light on theory and heavy on hands-on coding so we can explore Flutter in action. We’re going to dive in to some real Flutter code and build an app in real-time.

This is our first event as GDG Lawrence! We appreciate your support in registering for this event and attending, so as a token of our appreciation, we will be raffling Flutter swag and some Google hardware, so please attend!

Pizza and drinks will also be provided for registered attendees.

Agenda

6:00PM - Doors Open
6:00PM / 6:15PM - Socializing and Intros
6:15PM / 7:15PM - Main Presentation / Demos
7:15PM / 7:30PM - Wrap-up and questions

Location:
Lawrence Public Library
51 Lawrence Street, (3rd Floor - Robert Frost Room)
Lawrence, MA

events.name: Cloud Study Jam Lawrence
events.description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!

Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with the Cloud Console, Kubernetes, Security, IoT on Cloud, and Machine Learning.

Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you want

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger.

Food and drinks for registered attendees, as well as swag!

Agenda:
10:00AM: 3 Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs
11:30pm: Break
12:00pm:
Hands-on Lab: Intro to Docker
Hands-on Lab: Hello Node Kubernetes
Hands-on Lab: Build a Slack Bot with Node.js on Kubernetes
2:00pm: Event ends

LOCATION:
Northern Essex Community College (NECC)
Dr. Ibrahim El-Hefni Allied Health & Technology Center
Room LC-301 (3rd. Floor)
414 Common Street · Lawrence, MA 01840

Thanks to Northern Essex Community College (NECC) and the Admissions Office for sponsoring us by providing such a great venue!
events.how_to_find_us:
Dr. Ibrahim El-Hefni Allied Health & Technology Center
Room LC-301 (3rd. Floor)

events.name: Google I/O Extended Lawrence
events.description:
Save the date! Google I/O Extended Lawrence will have a 3-part series session based on Google I/O Extended '19 events around Building Cross-Platform Mobile Applications for IOS and Android using Flutter SDK.

This is the first session of a 3-part series.

SCHEDULE

10:00 AM - Doors open / Intros
10:15 AM - 11:00 AM - Setting up your environment for Flutter Developer
11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - Intro to Flutter Lab (pt.1)
12:00 PM - 1:00 PM - Lunch / What's new in Flutter (from Google IO) video
1:00PM - 2:00PM - Intro to Flutter Lab (pt.2)
2:00PM - 3:00PM - Wrap-up / Follow-ups

Food and swag will be provided to attendees.

THIS IS A BYOL EVENT (BRING YOUR OWN LAPTOP)

PARKING AVAILABLE RIGHT IN FRONT OF NECC, NEXT TO WENDY'S (PARKING LOT C)

events.name: Google I/O Extended Lawrence
events.description:
Google I/O Extended (pt.2)

Save the date! Google I/O Extended Lawrence will have a 3-part series session based on Google I/O Extended '19 events around Building Cross-Platform Mobile Applications for IOS and Android using Flutter SDK.

This is the second session of a 3-part series.

SCHEDULE

10:00 AM - Doors open / Intros
10:15 AM - 11:00 PM - Intro to Material Design in Flutter - Basics (Lab 1)
11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - Intro to Material Design in Flutter - Layout & Structure (Lab 2)
12:00 PM - 1:00 PM - Lunch / What's new in Flutter (from Google IO) video
1:00PM - 2:00PM - Intro to Material Design in Flutter - Theming (Lab 3)
2:00PM - 3:00PM - Wrap-up / Follow-ups

Note: the 3rd part of this series will be a hackathon. During this event we will be providing more details about it, where you'll be able to submit your idea, and start working on it until the last event, where you'll submit your creation.

Food and swag will be provided to attendees.

THIS IS A BYOL EVENT (BRING YOUR OWN LAPTOP)

PARKING AVAILABLE RIGHT IN FRONT OF NECC, NEXT TO WENDY'S (PARKING LOT C)

events.name: Google I/O Extended Lawrence
events.description:
Google I/O Extended (pt.3) / FLUTTER MINI HACKATHON

Save the date! Google I/O Extended Lawrence will have a 3-part series session based on Google I/O Extended '19 events around Building Cross-Platform Mobile Applications for IOS and Android using Flutter SDK.

This is the third and final session of this series, where we will celebrate by holding a mini Flutter Hackathon based on all your knowledge acquired throughout the 3-part series. Submit your creation for as small as it is, all submissions are valid so long as:
-they are not published apps
-have been created during the 3-sessions
-is an original creation of yours

SCHEDULE

10:00 AM - Doors open / Intros
10:15 AM - 12:00 PM:
First Part of the Hackathon:
-Submit your idea for the hackathon / link to shared document will be posted soon.
-Refine your project
-Get assistance from the facilitators
-Submit your final projects / link to shared folder will be posted soon.

12:00 PM - 1:00 PM - Lunch / What's new in Flutter (from Google IO) video

1:00PM - 2:00PM - Demos of submissions
2:00PM - 2:30PM - Judging submissions
2:30PM - 3:00PM - Prizes for the top 3 submissions & Wrap-up

RSVP Here
https://surveyhero.com/c/85de9fc6

Criteria for the hackathon:
-Your app MUST be built in Flutter (of course!)
-You can bring your idea and execute it during that day, with assistance from the facilitators
-If you've already started, bring your code and finish that day and submit it.
-If this is your first time, you still have a shot at submitting. Here's the link to the labs covered during the last 2 sessions
https://codelabs.developers.google.com/?cat=Flutter

Food and swag will be provided to attendees.

THIS IS A BYOL EVENT (BRING YOUR OWN LAPTOP)

PARKING AVAILABLE RIGHT IN FRONT OF NECC, NEXT TO WENDY'S (PARKING LOT C)

events.name: GDG Lawrence Machine Learning Cloud Study Jam (pt.1)
events.description:
GDG Lawrence is pleased to announce part 1 of its upcoming series of sessions around AI and Machine Learning in the Google Cloud, focused on Image Processing and Language Processing.

Join a community of like-minded developers and explore the latest Google Cloud technologies as a team.

Join us for our upcoming Cloud Study Jam and get hands-on experience with Machine Learning. After the Study Jam, you’ll receive 30-days free access to the entire Qwiklabs catalogue, so you can keep developing your skills at home. Complete all of the labs in the session’s quest, and you’ll learn an additional free month of access to Qwiklabs as well as a badge for your online profile.

Food will be served, as well as swag for the attendees.

IN ORDER TO GUARANTEE A SPOT, YOU MUST FILL OUT THE FOLLOWING SURVEY (even if you're on the waitlist)
https://surveyhero.com/c/355aaa14

Agenda:
10:00 AM - Welcome! Introduction
10:30 AM - Get free access to Quiklabs
11:00 AM - Intro to ML: Image Processing Quest (5 Hands-on Labs)
---Cloud ML Engine Lab
---APIs Explorer Lab
---AutoML Vision Lab
---Cloud Vision API Lab
---Cloud Vision, Natural Language and Translation APIs Lab
12:00 PM - Lunch Break
1:00 PM - Intro to ML: Language Processing (5 Hands-on Labs)
---Google Cloud Speech API Lab
---Cloud Natural Language API Lab
---Entity and Sentiment Analysis with the Natural Language API
---Speech to Text Transcription with the Cloud Speech API

Bonus: Cloud ML Challenge - Complete the challenges that will be provided during this session and get in a raffle to win a Google Home Mini!

LOCATION:
Northern Essex Community College (NECC) Lawrence Campus
LH Building
420 Common St., Room LH304
Lawrence, MA 01840

BRING YOUR LAPTOP!

PARKING AVAILABLE ON PARKING LOT C (NEXT TO WENDY'S)

events.name: GDG Lawrence Machine Learning Cloud Study Jam (pt.2)
events.description:
GDG Lawrence is pleased to announce part 2 of its upcoming series of sessions around AI and Machine Learning in the Google Cloud, focused on Tensorflow on the Google Cloud Platform (GCP).

Join a community of like-minded developers and explore the latest Google Cloud technologies as a team.

Join us for our upcoming Cloud Study Jam and get hands-on experience with Machine Learning. After the Study Jam, you’ll receive 30-days free access to the entire Qwiklabs catalogue, so you can keep developing your skills at home. Complete all of the labs in the session’s quest, and you’ll earn an additional free month of access to Qwiklabs as well as a badge for your online profile.

Food will be served, as well as swag for the attendees.

Agenda:
10:00 AM - Welcome! Introduction
10:30 AM - Get free access to Quiklabs
11:00 AM - Intermediate ML: TensorFlow on GCP (2 Hands-on Labs)
--Machine Learning with TensorFlow
--TensorFlow for Poets
12:00 PM - Lunch Break
1:00 PM - Intermediate ML: TensorFlow on GCP (3 Hands-on Labs)
--Image Classification of Coastline Images Using TensorFlow on AI Platform
--Predict Housing Prices with Tensorflow and AI Platform
--Creating an Object Detection Application Using TensorFlow

Complete the badges during this session and get in a raffle to win a Google Home Mini!

Please fill out the following short 5-question survey, which will guarantee you a spot at the Cloud Study Jam. Please complete this survey by EOD Thursday, November 14th.
https://surveyhero.com/c/a7c0be04

LOCATION:
Northern Essex Community College (NECC) Lawrence Campus
LH Building
420 Common St., Room LH304
Lawrence, MA 01840

BRING YOUR OWN LAPTOP!

PARKING AVAILABLE ON PARKING LOT C (NEXT TO WENDY'S)

events.name: GDG Lawrence Flutter Interact
events.description:
Join us for a day of creation and collaboration with the world. We’ll showcase the latest from Google Design and Flutter, Google’s free and open source UI toolkit to build beautiful, natively compiled applications for mobile, web, and desktop - all from a single codebase.

GDG Lawrence will host a viewing party event on Saturday, Dec. 14th.
More details on the schedule in the next few days. Meanwhile, reserve your spot!

Food and swag will be provided to attendees, as well as amazing content and labs coming from Flutter, so don't miss it!

Note: Flutter Interact events will run from Dec. 11th - Dec. 25th. GDG Lawrence will hold its event on Saturday, Dec. 14th.

More information on Flutter Interact here https://events.google.com/flutter-interact/

LH Building
420 Common St., Room LH304
Lawrence, MA 01840

events.name: 2019 GDG Lawrence Community Holiday Party!
events.description:
Join us for our end of year holiday party where we will have food, drinks, music, swag, and raffle off some fun tech gadgets.

We're excited to be celebrating with you - the GDG Lawrence Community, and thank you for all the support you've given us throughout this our first year - and many more to come!

We'll be celebrating at Spicket River Brewery - since this is technically a bar, you will need to be 21+ to enter. We'll have a private space reserved for 20+ people so make sure to register soon!

SCHEDULE
6:30 pm - Socialize, food, & beers
7:30pm - Tech gadget raffles
8:00pm - Wrap up

See you there! Happy Holidays!
events.how_to_find_us:
Spicket River Brewery
56 Island St. Lawrence, MA, 01840

events.name: GDG Lawrence Firebase Study Jam
events.description:
GDG Lawrence is back, now with Google Firebase!

Join a community of like-minded developers and explore the latest Firebase for Web technologies as a team.

Want to get started building web apps? Learn how to do that with Firebase!

Join us for our Firebase Study Jam! Together we'll work through Firebase for web codelabs prepared by Google instructors. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Firebase.

Raffles and licenses for attendees who complete the provided codelabs.

Agenda:
10:00 AM - Welcome! Introductions
10:30 AM - Intro to Firebase
11:00 AM - Codelab : Get to know Firebase for Web
12:00 PM - Break
1:00 PM - Get know Cloud Firestore
1:30 PM - Codelab: Local Development with Emulator Suite
2:00 PM - Codelab: Streamline application with development with Firebase Extensions
3:00 PM - Closing and Wrap-up

PLEASE READ:
-Prerequisites: Join the Firebase Study Jam Google Group here
https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/firebase-study-jam

Joining this group will whitelist your email address to grant you access to create a Google.dev Account. Please allow ~ 15 min. for request to go through. Click on the link above to access the group and click on the "Join" button to join the group.

At the event we’ll use the Google.dev platform. If you have used google.dev before, great! Make sure you know your password. If you haven’t, no worries! You still have access to all Firebase codelabs without having to register or sign in.

More info to be provided the day of the event.

LOCATION:
DUE TO THE GROWING CONCERN AROUND THE CORONAVIRUS (COVID-19), and in alignment with the best practices laid out by the CDC, WHO, and other health authorities, THIS EVENT WILL BE HELD ONLINE ONLY. The health and well-being of the GDG Community is our top priority, hence the reason to hold it as an online event.

Join the GDG Lawrence Slack Channel #study-jams for further instructions and details about the event by following this link => https://join.slack.com/t/gdglawrence/shared_invite/zt-6w6dop0n-wKS9uPeOO1aHFDvmgSpyDA

Thank you.
GDG Lawrence Organizing Team

organizers.name: Roman J.
organizers.bio: Interested in meeting with people whom with I share the same career interests in technology, such as Cloud Computing, Mobile Development, Web Development, etc.

group_profile.intro: Software Engineer, Mobile Developer, Web Guru, Javascript Ninja, AR/VR Enthusiast

I am from Derry, NH where I work as a full stack JavaScript/Typescript engineer.  Front-End (Angular, React), APIs and micro-services (NodeJS/Express), AWS Cloud Architecture, DevOps, Groovy, Jenkins, Linux, Powershell.
